title: The Lost Skeleton of Cadavra
content: There's a camp send-up of old sci-fi films coming out, called [The Lost Skeleton of Cadavra](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142437/http:/www.apple.com/trailers/sony_pictures/lost_skeleton/). They do a very convincing job of mimicking the typography and effects of the time in the trailer. It also looks pretty funny.
author: crugen

comments.content: It's really great! I'm going for it!
I give the trailer five stars for era-accurate typography. The music, camerawork, etc. seem right on target as well.

By the way, if you go to the website for the movie (Go [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142437/http:/www.sonypictures.com/movies/thelostskeletonofcadavra/index.html) first, then click on "Enter Site") there's more stuff to see. The "collectible" artifacts ("Skelectibles") are very nicely done.
It reminded me of a B movie my father made in the late 50s or early 60s called The She Creature. My mother also did some calligraphy for movies during the 70s. I love this stuff.
Thanks Chris for this post I got a big smile watching that clip.
